description: Complete remaining polish, optimization, and accessibility improvements for Polymarket Learn educational platform

userStories.title: Add code splitting with lazy loading for routes
userStories.description: As a user, I want the app to load faster so that I can start learning immediately. Currently the bundle is 846KB, which exceeds the 300KB target. Implement React.lazy and Suspense for route-based code splitting.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page components are lazily loaded
Learn layout and views are lazily loaded
Main bundle size is reduced significantly
Loading states are shown during lazy loading
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented. Main bundle reduced from 846KB to 234KB. Code split into 23 chunks.

userStories.title: Add GSAP ScrollTrigger animations to lesson content
userStories.description: As a user, I want content to animate in as I scroll through lessons for a more engaging experience. Add scroll-triggered reveal animations to headings, paragraphs, and code blocks in LessonView.
acceptanceCriteria: Headings animate in with subtle fade/slide as they enter viewport
Paragraphs and list items have staggered reveal animations
Animations are performant and don't cause layout shift
Animations respect prefers-reduced-motion
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented GSAP ScrollTrigger for headings, paragraphs, lists, code blocks, and callouts. Respects prefers-reduced-motion.

userStories.title: Add smooth page transitions between lessons
userStories.description: As a user, I want smooth transitions when navigating between lessons so the experience feels polished. Use Framer Motion AnimatePresence for page transitions.
acceptanceCriteria: Content fades/slides out when leaving a lesson
Content fades/slides in when entering a lesson
Transitions are quick (under 300ms) and not jarring
Scroll position resets appropriately
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented page transitions using Framer Motion. AnimatePresence wraps Outlet in Layout. Transitions respect prefers-reduced-motion.

userStories.title: Add skip to content link for accessibility
userStories.description: As a keyboard user, I want a skip link so I can bypass the navigation and go directly to main content. This is a WCAG 2.1 AA requirement.
acceptanceCriteria: Skip link appears on focus at the top of the page
Clicking skip link moves focus to main content
Skip link is visually hidden until focused
Works in both Layout and Landing views
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Created SkipLink component. Added to both Layout and Landing. Skip link is sr-only until focused, then appears at top-left.

userStories.title: Add focus trap to search modal
userStories.description: As a keyboard user, I want focus to be trapped inside the search modal when it's open so I don't accidentally tab out of it. This improves accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: When search modal opens, focus moves to search input
Tab cycles through focusable elements within modal only
Shift+Tab cycles backwards through modal elements
Escape closes the modal and returns focus to trigger
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented focus trap with Tab/Shift+Tab cycling. Focus returns to trigger on close. Added role=dialog and aria-modal for screen readers.

userStories.title: Add keyboard navigation to FAQ accordion
userStories.description: As a keyboard user, I want to navigate the FAQ accordion using arrow keys so I can efficiently browse questions. Following ARIA accordion pattern.
acceptanceCriteria: Arrow Up/Down moves focus between FAQ items
Enter or Space toggles the focused FAQ item
Home moves focus to first FAQ item
End moves focus to last FAQ item
Proper ARIA attributes are in place
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented full ARIA accordion pattern. Arrow keys, Home/End navigate. Enter/Space toggle. Added aria-expanded, aria-controls, and proper heading structure.

userStories.title: Add prefers-reduced-motion support
userStories.description: As a user with motion sensitivity, I want animations to be disabled or reduced when I have prefers-reduced-motion enabled in my OS settings.
acceptanceCriteria: Framer Motion animations respect prefers-reduced-motion
GSAP animations are disabled or minimized for reduced motion
Page still functions correctly with animations disabled
Transitions can use instant/minimal movement
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Added MotionConfig with reducedMotion='user' in main.tsx. LazyMotion used for bundle optimization. GSAP animations already check prefersReducedMotion().

userStories.title: Add aria-live announcements for dynamic content
userStories.description: As a screen reader user, I want to be notified when search results update or when I mark a lesson complete so I know the action succeeded.
acceptanceCriteria: Search results count is announced when results change
Lesson completion is announced when marked complete
Progress updates are announced appropriately
Announcements use aria-live polite, not assertive
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Created AriaLiveProvider with polite/assertive regions. Search announces results count. Lesson completion announced.

userStories.title: Add loading skeleton for lesson content
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a content skeleton while lessons are rendering so I know content is loading. This improves perceived performance.
acceptanceCriteria: Skeleton shows animated placeholders for title, content blocks
Skeleton matches approximate layout of actual content
Skeleton uses subtle pulse animation
Skeleton disappears when content is ready
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Created LessonSkeleton with animated placeholders matching actual layout. Used as Suspense fallback for LessonView.

userStories.title: Add meta tags and document title updates
userStories.description: As a user, I want the browser tab title to reflect the current lesson so I can identify tabs easily. Also add basic meta tags for SEO.
acceptanceCriteria: Document title updates to show lesson title
Landing page has appropriate title
Meta description is set appropriately
Title format is consistent (e.g., 'Lesson Name | Polymarket Learn')
Build completes without errors
TypeCheck passes
userStories.notes: Created useDocumentTitle and useMetaDescription hooks. LessonView and CategoryOverview update titles. index.html has base meta tags.
